text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commission" means the Governor's Advisory Commission on Maryland Wine and Grape Growing.

"Grape grower" means a person who:
Grows grapes for commercial purposes; and
Sells at least $10,000 worth of grapes each year; or
Has planted at least 3 acres of vines of a type used for the production of wine.
"Viticulture" means the cultivation and study of grapes and grape vines.
"Wine" has the meaning stated in Article 2B, § 1-102 of the Code.
"Winery" means an establishment that has a winery license or limited winery license under Article 2B, § 2-204 or § 2-205 of the Code.
